Detailed Description

This class provides API independent abstraction of texture concept.

virtual void renderer::Texture::loadTexture ( unsigned  textureType,
unsigned  level,
unsigned  textureInternalFormat,
unsigned  textureStorageFormat,
unsigned  textureStorage,
unsigned  width,
unsigned  height,
unsigned  side_or_depth,
void *  data 
) [pure virtual]

This function loads either 3D, either cube texture. The texture could be compressed (in most cases only cube textures could be compressed). VBO's for each texture level/side are generated on the fly when needed If the pointer to data is NULL, than texture is created without data, which can be set later using corresponding VBO or some render-to-texture method.

Parameters:
textureType is a type of texture to be loaded (see the remark above) described by TextureType
level is a mip level of a texture to be loaded.
textureInternalFormat is a format of internal (e.g. VRAM) texture representation. Described by TextureInternalFormat.
textureStorageFormat is a format of in RAM texture representation (described by TextureFormat). The value is not significant if the texture is compressed(e.g. textureInternalFormat is >= renderer::TextureInternalFormat::COMPRESSED). (Engine limitation: compressed textures ought to be stored inside RAM in compressed form, despite some API could compress texture by them self)
textureStorage is a data format of each texture component required by textureStorageFormat (described by TextureStorage). The value is not significant if the texture is compressed.
width is a width of texture
height is a height of texture
side_or_depth is either a cube texture side described by CubeTextureSide or a depth level for 3D texture
data is a pointer to data to be loaded. Could be NULL
Exceptions:
renderer::DriverException on any error occured (mostly the incorrect format errors)

virtual void renderer::Texture::loadTexture ( unsigned  textureType,
unsigned  level,
unsigned  textureInternalFormat,
unsigned  textureStorageFormat,
unsigned  textureStorage,
unsigned  width,
unsigned  height,
void *  data 
) [pure virtual]

This function loads either 1D, either 2D, either rectangle texture (i.e. textures with unclamped texture coordinates). The texture could be compressed (in most cases only 2D textures could be compressed). If the pointer to data is NULL, than texture is created without data, which can be set later using corresponding VBO or some render-to-texture method.

Parameters:
textureType is a type of texture to be loaded (see the remark above) described by TextureType
level is a mip level of a texture to be loaded.
textureInternalFormat is a format of internal (e.g. VRAM) texture representation. Described by TextureInternalFormat.
textureStorageFormat is a format of in RAM texture representation (described by TextureFormat). The value is not significant if the texture is compressed(e.g. textureInternalFormat is >= renderer::TextureInternalFormat::COMPRESSED). (Engine limitation: compressed textures ought to be stored inside RAM in compressed form, despite some API could compress texture by them self)
textureStorage is a data format of each texture component required by textureStorageFormat (described by TextureStorage). The value is not significant if the texture is compressed.
width is a width of texture
height is a height of texture
data is a pointer to data to be loaded. Could be NULL
Exceptions:
renderer::DriverException on any error occured (mostly the incorrect format errors)

virtual void* renderer::Texture::map ( unsigned  level = 0,
unsigned  side = 0 
) [pure virtual]

Maps a memory region for demanded texture level to memory for RW access. Please note, this command possibly wont block texture object from using. All changes are committed only after calling Texture::unmap method. The operation is pretty slow, so try to avoid it.

Parameters:
level is mip level of texture to map
side is a cube texture side (described by CubeTextureSide) for cube texture or forced to 0 for other texture types
Returns:
Pointer to a mapped memory region
Exceptions:
renderer::DriverException on any error

virtual void renderer::Texture::setMagFilter ( unsigned  filter  )  [pure virtual]

Sets the magnification filter. The texture magnification filter is used when the pixel being textured maps to an area less than or equal to one texture element.

Parameters:
filter is magnification filter. Could be TextureFilter::NEAREST or TextureFilter::LINEAR

virtual void renderer::Texture::setMinFilter ( unsigned  filter  )  [pure virtual]

Set the minifying filter. The texture minifying filter is used whenever the pixel being textured maps to an area greater than one texture element.

Parameters:
filter is minifying filter. Could be any of TextureFilter constants

virtual void renderer::Texture::unmap ( unsigned  level = 0,
unsigned  side = 0 
) [pure virtual]

Unmaps previously mapped memory region and commit changes done to accelerator. Only this method could be used to unmap a memory region. Pointer for mapped region becomes invalid The operation is pretty slow, so try to avoid it.

Parameters:
level is mip level of texture to map
side is a cube texture side (described by CubeTextureSide) for cube texture or forced to 0 for other texture types
Exceptions:
renderer::DriverException on any error
